DOC.brief_summary: This study aims to investigate the benefits of using first line heated humidification. The primary objective of this research is to determine the effect of high levels of humidification delivered by ThermoSmart™ on CPAP adherence. In addition, to determine if it is possible to predict which patients benefit the most (i.e. be more adherent with therapy) from high levels of humidification delivered by ThermoSmart.
DOC.brief_title: Study to Predict the Benefits of First-line Humidification Use and Comparison of the Effect of ThermoSmart™ and no Humidification on Adherence
DOC.criteria: Older than 18 years of age Diagnosed with OSA and eligible for CPAP treatment under local requirements (AHI>30 or if AHI is lower than 30, at least 10 micro arousals identified during diagnosis PSG). Naïve to CPAP therapy, i.e have not been prescribed, or used CPAP in the last 5 years Patients receiving social security coverage (excluding MEAs) Fluent spoken and written French Severe heart disease Coexisting lung disease Coexisting sleep disorder Pregnant Refused participation
